scenario: Corporate executive transportation scheduling requires collaboration between security teams, executives, and transportation providers, each holding sensitive threat assessments and undisclosed meeting locations.
task: Create a secure transportation schedule that ensures executive safety while accommodating private threat data and undisclosed locations. Agents must negotiate sharing sensitive information without compromising security.

agents.name: Security Chief
agents.role: Oversees the safety protocols for executive transportation, ensuring all potential threats are mitigated.
responsibilities: Conduct threat assessments based on current intelligence.
Coordinate with transportation providers to ensure safe routes.
Implement security measures at undisclosed meeting locations.
Manage security personnel during transport and at destinations.
Provide real-time updates to executives on security status.

Threat Level (High).reason: Details about specific threats could incite panic or compromise security measures.

Meeting Location (Confidential).reason: Revealing locations could lead to potential breaches in security.

public.Security Protocols: Standard operating procedures for executive transport

agents.name: Executive Assistant
agents.role: Facilitates the scheduling and coordination of executive meetings and transportation.
responsibilities: Schedule transportation for executives based on their availability.
Communicate with security about the executives' needs during transport.
Ensure all logistics are handled discreetly and efficiently.
Keep track of all executive appointments and changes in schedule.
Liaise with transportation providers to confirm arrangements.

Executive Itinerary (Sensitive).reason: Disclosing schedules could expose executives to risks.

Transportation Provider Contracts.reason: Contracts contain proprietary agreements that must remain confidential.

public.Transportation Schedule: Available upon request from authorized personnel

agents.name: Transportation Provider
agents.role: Responsible for providing safe and reliable transportation for executives.
responsibilities: Ensure vehicles meet safety and security standards.
Coordinate with security for safe routes and schedules.
Provide real-time tracking of transportation for security teams.
Maintain confidentiality regarding client information and schedules.
Adapt to last-minute changes in transportation needs.

Vehicle Security Features (Confidential).reason: Specific features could be exploited by malicious actors.

Client List (Sensitive).reason: Revealing client information could harm business relationships.

success_criteria.Timeliness of arrivals: â‰¥95% on-time arrivals = Success; 80-94% = Partial; <80% = Failure

deliverable: A comprehensive transportation schedule balancing security and executive needs.

public: All transports must be completed within scheduled windows.
Executives must not be informed of potential threats unless necessary.
Transportation must comply with safety regulations.
private: Threat assessments must remain confidential and not be fully disclosed.
Meeting locations can only be shared on a need-to-know basis.
Negotiations with transportation providers must remain undisclosed.

penalties_utilities: Penalties are expressed as utility losses (e.g., -300, -200, -150, -100). Utilities are expressed as gains (e.g., +100, +75, +50).
